0.author: FTSRookb
0.body:
Someone made a good point on how can I be sure shadow shaping connected maps forces non shadow shaped connected maps. 

So I did a quick test of 30 arcades(5 connected) blocked all but one connected and dropped 10 of said connected map. Assuming the base connected map rate is 30% then if it blocks it would be 30% and if it doesn't and just gets rid of the maps then it would be 6% to drop said connected map. So if it was that 6% this would be 555% above avg and if it is the 30% then it would only be 11.1% above the avg. Or in terms of stastics based on the 30% it would have a p value of .6903 to be that 30% based on this data set vs a p value of 2.91E-10 assuming the 6%.  
  
TLDR pretty much guaranteed it forces a connected map

0.body: Yes can sustain based on this data set taking into consideration other factors mentioned above

6.author: zixav

Only brand on enemy deal more damage, I tested it once. So explosions happens on Expire (if you replace brand with another brand before it expire explosion will NOT happens) and Expire can happens when on enemy or out of enemy, so these that explode when not on enemy will deal less damage.

As for my test it was ultra simple, I had 2 enemies (each with brand) or 1 enemy (with two brands at once) and I used storm brand (huge multiplier on branded enemy), if all that is need for enemy to get more damage was being branded, then in both scenarios enemies should die in same time, but nope, in second enemy died much faster.

10.author: psychomap
10.body:
Well, DD isn't a Nimis build, and rather than calling a build that uses Nimis and something extra low budget, I'd simply say that any build using Nimis is not low budget by default.

By the same logic you could call Headhunter or Mageblood builds low budget if they only use 10 divines in other items. If the build uses an expensive unique, it's not a low budget build.

10.author: TheBlindReaper
10.body:
He didn't say DD was a low budget build, he was saying 40Divs is on the low budget SPECTRUM of the build. It's the same logic how Tornado Shot has Low Budget versions that works ok, yet wouldn't really be as good as actual strong Low Budget Builds such as League Starters. But TS can scale up to Mirror Tier budget and become much better than a dedicated League Starter. In this case for DD, 40Div's would be what's considered the low budget required to get it to work smoothly.

And yes, you could consider your HH/MB builds low budget in the context of a HH/MB build because you're at the low end spectrum of the build's potential. If your 10Div + HH/MB ends up with like 10M DPS and moderate survivability when a high end version of your same build costs 1 Mirror and goes up to 200M and is neigh unkillable, you are considered to be on a lower budget.

Take a real life example, say you are buying a house and the bare minimum you need is a 5 room building. At the high end of say 2Mil, you get lots of amenities, good location, a front and backyard and even a garage. But you can't afford that, so you look for one on a lower budget of 1Mil. Sure, it doesn't have most of the above, but it's just enough for your needs. It's still low budget in the context of 5 room buildings even though a high end 3 room building could have been 700k

10.author: psychomap
10.body:
I think you're making a mistake in conflating positive and comparative.

Low**er** budget doesn't mean **low** budget.

Buying a house isn't low budget either, even if you pay a few hundred thousand instead of several million.

10.author: TheBlindReaper
10.body:
A Low budget is the minimum you need to hit to achieve something. If it costs at least 1 Mil to get your 5 Room Building when the average cost is 2.5M, that's still low budget. Your main goal in the first place was to get a 5 Room Building, as cheap as possible, which is 1Mil in this case. Or if someone says, I want you to build a bridge with as low of a budget as possible, do you go "Bridge too expensive, can't build". That would be saying not having enough Budget to even meet Low Budget. You'd instead try to minimize the cost to build a bridge and attempt it, and if the min cost is 10M, that's Low Budget in the context of building the required Bridge.

that's why in the CONTEXT of buying a House (Build), a 3 room Building (League Starter) would be considered Low budget compared to buying a 5 room Building (High Potential Endgame Build). You are talking about the Context of Builds, when the poster is talking about the Context of JUST High Potential DD

In the Context of buying a 5 Room Building (High End DD), spending 1Mil (40Div's) is considered Low Budget when a high end 5 Room Building is 4Mil (1 Mirror). You WANT a 5 Room Building, not 3 Room, not 4 Room, not even a Mansion. So low Budget would be the cheaper spectrum of a 5 Room Building.

Are you going to say, I want to eat Beef (Play High Potential DD), but I'm poor, so I'll buy Low Budget Beef. And then you buy Fish (Play Poison Seismic) just cause it happens to be cheaper than Beef? No, you'd buy Ground Beef (40 Div's)  instead of A1 Grade Wagyu (1 Mirror) because your goal is to eat Beef. Both are Beef but, one is obviously still cheaper even if Beef is much more expensive than Fish. In the context of Food, then Fish could be considered Low Budget compared to Beef

10.author: psychomap
10.body:
No, a low budget is a budget that is objectively *low*, and there are plenty of things that *cannot* be achieved on a low budget.

A low budget isn't defined by being the minimum for whatever you want to achieve.

You might be able to afford ground beef on a low budget, but you can't afford steak. Because the minimum budget for steak isn't within the bounds of low budget.

And there are *actual* low budget DD builds that you can play at league start.

If a client asks me to build a website with 100s of features on a low budget, I'll tell them that it's impossible.

10.author: TheBlindReaper
10.body: ah yes, so you're gonna tell me that what ppl call, Low Budget Films which allow from 400k to 2 Million of budget, is also very little. I didn’t know Steak costed more than 2Mil a meal. Even definitions uses the term Relative.

32.author: Raeandray
32.body:
You’ve intentionally switched the chess analogy. The move isn’t forced even if making the move causes you to lose (if that were the case you’d just resign). The move is forced because if don’t make it you’re guaranteed to lose. You’re making the best move you have available to win. And even then, you still choose the move.

This move isn’t forced, it’s just the best option available. If you don’t like deceptive mirror you’re free to take other options. In this case you cannot lose anyway. You’re just deciding between high risk high reward, or lower risk lower reward.

32.author: NakedMan8
32.body:
> the best option

That's precisely why an option is forced. Because the best option is the only reasonable option, just like it is in chess if you understand some chess theory. 

Risk assessment can be reduced down to average expected value, which means that one will be objectively better than the other. The mirror will always be by far the highest avg expected value regardless of the present risk in this scenario.

The choice is an illusion 

Take another example, chiseling your maps. You might make more money back from the quant than the chisels were worth. You might not. But there is actually no choice here, an average you absolutely will make more than the chisels are worth, the chisels are always objectively better

32.author: Raeandray
32.body:
Virtually every decision in POE has a good/better/best option. By your argument everything is forced, since there’s almost always an option that’s the best.

In reality you’re just evaluating the risk vs reward, and deciding for yourself. Your options aren’t forced just because you’ve decided the risk is worth it.

32.author: NakedMan8
32.body:
> By your argument everything is forced, since there’s almost always an option that’s the best.

That's exactly how the game is if your goal is to be as efficient as possible

32.author: Raeandray
32.body: Most people’s goal is not just about efficiency. But even then, there are plenty of options even within efficient builds. And again, you’re still making a choice. Maybe a less efficient method is more fun. Or you’re better at it. Or it’s less risky.

32.author: NakedMan8
32.body: Yeah nothing I say will matter so just gonna end it here

32.author: Raeandray
32.body: As of anything I say will matter to you either lol.

32.author: NakedMan8
32.body: Yeah it won't but only one of us thinks there's a real choice when it's a 50/50 chance to get a mirror or not so...

32.author: Raeandray
32.body: It’s not a 50/50 chance to get a mirror. The deceptive mirror has a chance to proc twice. Assuming the mirror procs at a 50% rate, it’s a 25% chance. Plus the added risk of the deceptive mirror screwing up the end of your run.

37.author: MasklinGNU
37.body: I’m talking about projectiles, not AoE overlap. Yes, creeping frost/fireball/kb etc can AoE overlap but the PROJECTILES aren’t shotgunning, the AoE is. Tornado shot you could make a case for, but it’s the secondary projectiles that can hit multiple times, the primary projectiles cannot shotgun at all. Ice spear is the only skill in the game where the *primary PROJECTILES can shotgun* ever since they nerfed kinetic bolt’s shotgunning 2 years ago

37.author: BitterAfternoon
37.body:
Barrage.  Any bow skill with Barrage Support.  Lancing Steel.  Think there's a couple more i'm forgetting.

Any sequentially-firing skill is the same (all projectiles can hit) - and ice spear wasn't even the first one of those.

37.author: MasklinGNU
37.body: Yeah I wasn’t counting those because they’re very obviously sequential while ice spear is more simultaneous like true shotgunning. Clicking lancing steel and then running around for a while with your turret firing off projectiles one after another at different targets really doesn’t feel like shotgunning. Adding projectiles to barrage and lancing steel also very noticeably increases their duration while the same is not true for ice spear. *I recognize that ice spear is sequential* and that is why it “shotguns” but I’m calling it shotgunning even thought it technically isn’t because in form and function it shotguns more so than any other skill (ie very sequential lancing steel/barrage etc or non-projectile AoE “shotgunning” of fireball/creeping frost etc) in the game, sans maybe secondary projectiles from tornado shot or something like that

37.author: BitterAfternoon
37.body:
Projectiles do not increase regular barrage's duration - it just fires more projectiles over the same attack time.  Only Barrage Support has that "feature" that the attack time gets longer.

There is actually a skill that *really* shotguns - Shrapnel Ballista.

45.author: Tharos-the-Swift
45.body:
I ended up dropping 3/5 flasks, just sticking to the two I needed to actually cast spells without running out of mana. That was after the 500 resolve loss room, and I think I was able to clear another 2 rooms before I lost my last 150 resolve/inspiration. One of which was a find the exit room, so I ran it with 0 flasks, so it doesn't really count. 

Even if we assume you could switch to 2 flasks needed, and only have to activate each of them once; you're still taking 20 resolve per room, which is as much as Spiked Exit if you have more than your starting resolve remaining.

45.author: Tharos-the-Swift
45.body:
Yes, and that's exactly my point. Imagine if "Monsters are immune to X Damage/Crits" was a random MINOR affliction you could get in Sanctum. 

It would be objectively bad from a design perspective. It introduces no counterplay, no thoughtful decision-making; just "Man, sure hope your build isn't based on Chaos damage. Would suck to be that guy." Expedition is different from Sanctum because you can ALWAYS read the remnant modifiers and choose not to detonate some.   


For bonus points, there's only 3 afflictions in the game that cause you to lose resolve outside of taking damage like normal; Spiked Exit, Death Toll, and Liquid Cowardice. Liquid Cowardice is worse than Spiked Exit if you use more than 1 flask a room and have at least 200 resolve, which is pretty much true of every single build I've ever seen, though many can limit flask use to mitigate it.  
Death Toll deals 250 resolve damage, which seems like a lot, but that's only 25 flask uses.   
If we assume you're a Pathfinder with +3 charges per 3 seconds, the average flask uses 30 charges, and you have +66% charges gained (all easy to do as Pathfinder), you would automatically trigger 4 magic flasks that many times in just under 2 minutes, completely ignoring charges gained on kill or crit. And Death Toll takes an entire floor to kick in. Seems to me like Liquid Cowardice should be a major affliction at least.

53.author: wheresmattynow
53.body:
Knowint the mechanics makes a massive difference. Its thebone thing that makes nolofer streamers able to do with 10div what would twke you 100div. Hell, google "level 1 izaro" or "shaper no gear". Of course lots of fights are bullshit especialt with cancer mods like actionspeed but poe has plenty of space for mechanical excellence (of course nuking everything off screen is easier so most do that). Less risky to instaphase uber bosses than dance around them for 5min. 

You can finish the campaign with essences and bases. No need to id anything.

No clownery i just think youre overestimating some of the difficulty spikes and mechanicqm obstacles. It  dilutes some of your actually fair criticisms.

53.author: FarAssistance815
53.body:
>No clownery i just think youre overestimating some of the difficulty spikes and mechanicqm obstacles. It dilutes some of your actually fair criticisms.

ok and I disagree with you completely

I'm not even really talking about bosses, but bosses actually have effort put into their design which is why people can do *some* bosses at a low level. izaro's mechanics are insanely easy to predict though. same with shapers. other bosses with shit all over the screen? not so much. also you'll find a lot of the people that do those encounters like that run EXTREMELY gimmicky builds. these are not the yard stick to measure how good the rest of the game is for 99% of the playerbase


poe has space for mechanical excellence but its reserved for, like you said, complete no lifers. the game has basically no balance. know the game like a textbook or get instagibbed by everything. its poorly designed. there shouldn't be a cliff between people who have a general understanding of the game and nolifers but there is. all I want is a logical and smoother curve which is easily achieved by reducing the level of slot machine that the game has and toning back the extreme variance in encounters. downing the hardest content in the game (uber bosses) should require good knowledge. but there is no balance in the rest of the game which results in no smooth progression to build up to that point. and even in these fights a lot of builds completely trivialize the content because of no balance. I think instaphasing shouldn't even exist

53.author: wheresmattynow
53.body:
as long as GGG doesn't have a damage cap instaphasing will exist (and I'd say a poe without instaphasing is a worse poe but that's my personal take). 

There's certainly much they could do to make crafting and gearing more approachable. 

I think that there's a lot of merit to what you say. For me, knowing how POE can be an easy game with minimised hurdles takes you 5+ leagues to learn. So at the very least the steep learning curve is a gate (but how do you eliminate that without removing most core old league content to simplify?)

53.author: FarAssistance815
53.body:
>as long as GGG doesn't have a damage cap instaphasing will exist (and I'd say a poe without instaphasing is a worse poe but that's my personal take).

fair enough, I'd prefer a damage cap though because I think it can allow them a lot greater control over combat and balance. and by damage cap I guess I just mean reducing the crazy variance in affixes. affix ranges go from nothing to damage in the hundreds of millions. seems impossible to balance for combat to be meaningful across a wide range of builds with such huge variance

>There's certainly much they could do to make crafting and gearing more approachable.

its more just inventory management I have an issue with. I think its fine for crafting to have aspects that aren't immediately obvious but when you combine how hard it is to find good rares on the ground with how annoying inventory management is, it basically means you're forced into this frankenstein combination of gear to allow you to hit res while having decent life and damage to get into maps. I wish the gearing process from leveling into like red map farming was just a bit smoother. I'm not struggling with it in the sense that I can't do it, I just find it really boring and unfun to do

>For me, knowing how POE can be an easy game with minimised hurdles takes you 5+ leagues to learn

I've played a lot of PoE and I know a lot of people are assuming I'm just shit lol. its a fair assumption I guess, but I really know how to play the game and a lot of the base mechanics. I know what builds are meta and how to make OP leveling characters and all of that. my issue is that if you don't follow the meta the balance of the game is in a way that you really see how broken it is. if you play a meta build its a breeze and you can cruise into red maps. if you don't you realize much of the progression and systems rest on you being able to chase the meta to enjoy them. if you don't have a very strong build the game can be pretty miserable a lot of the time even if you do know the mechanics. taking ages to down a boss with perfect dodging because your build lacks damage (because the skill has been neglected for whatever reason) doesn't feel good at all

I just wish the game was more balanced and less of a fuckfest of RNG. I think you can still have elite players dominating while reigning it in a bit. it's basically impossible for this game to turn into d3 so I wish people would stop bringing it up as a form of fearmongering. its just disingenuous at this point to keep using it as an example when the games aren't close and frankly will never be even similar in terms of depth or mechanics

53.author: wheresmattynow
53.body:
Damage cap kinda sucks because it's an artificial ceiling. However, who knows, they might go that route. and then when caracters reach the 35m dps cap (assuming they just copy dots) they'll spend every other point in survival. Then GGG will need to nerf defences to that ubers aren't afk tank snooze

you are right tho, Leagues with at least controlled RNG have been my favourite and most played. 

Harvest, obviously. Sentinel, too. There was RNG but at least it wasn't absurd brickfest.

53.author: FarAssistance815
53.body:
I think the game already has a determined artificial ceiling because it's simply the craziest multiplier of numbers you can get

there's a limit with that depending on the build, items, etc

if they culled the highest tiers of affixes on rares/uniques they should also do that to map rolls. stop mobs from rolling 400% crit for example. reduce it from 100% extra damage as fire to like 65% as the max. just throwing random numbers out but you get the point. it would not be perfect and there'd be a shitload of tears but I think reigning it in a little bit would be healthier for the game eventually. maybe it'd take a few leagues but there simply has to be some control or the game will forever be metaslave or suffer

59.author: Striker654
59.body:
> you can progress towards Maven + Exarch or Eater at the same time

Wait how?

59.author: Sidnv
59.body:
Special boss map drops or Breach. Your progress towards Maven isn't through witnessing normal bosses but by specing into the guardian and elderslayers map drop nodes at the top. Two special invitations (or one feared but that's obviously slower) gets you a Maven Writ.

You only turn on the maven beacon when witnessing the invitation bosses.

59.author: Striker654
59.body: But that doesn't progress maven and eater/exarch at the same time

59.author: Sidnv
59.body:
It does effectively. Yes, you don't actually see the Maven progress but running lots of maps with eater influence and the map drop nodes will give you a set of 8 maps you need to run a full maven. That is progress on both at the same time.

If your question is: can you Maven witness and Eater/Exarch witness at the same time, then the answer is no.

It definitely applies - 2 nodes is very good for general mapping - generally on hard bosses ppl run blade trap + cluster traps + withering touch anyway so they don't have to worry about withering step. It also keeps your trap count up for the % inc dmg bonuses.

Those 2 nodes are quite good though, I'd just play w/ withering step while mapping and wither won't be an issue.

61.author: aPatheticBeing
61.body:
The wording on the mod is the exact same as balance of terror, which is a popular option that 100% works on seismic. In trade, the ideal is either double despair (for general mapping convenience) or despair wither + temp chains cdr. Temp chains action speed is good on some specific bosses like elder/cortex where there are action speed slows, but I don't like using conditional buffs like that for freeze immunity.

https://www.poewiki.net/wiki/The_Balance_of_Terror

77.author: blvcksvn

77.author: Positive-Reaction-87
77.body:
Room level - yes. I speak about reward types.

To better illustrate:
Imagine you open sanctum in i1 and you have relics that reveal whole map. Because it was opened in i1 - you cannot get divines as rewards in any room and you see them all. So reward types are locked.
If you run next portals in i83 - reward TYPE you've seen in i1 will not change! What will change - after complition you will be offered 30 alts instead of 1 if you were to run in i1

77.author: Positive-Reaction-87
77.body: True. On second floor and later it uses average finished room level to calculate rewards for a new floor

78.author: sirgog
78.body:
GGG flushing the Harvest turd was an apology for the past failure (of gating the best loot in the game behind discord trading and a horrible gameplay loop) and somewhat of a promise never, ever, EVER to do such a stupid thing again.

It's as dead as other stupid design mistakes as the legacy Vinktar flask and the Eternal Orb.

And this is normal. GGG experiment with stupid ideas like recombinators and Eternals and Harvest that break the game, then they realise they make the game less fun, so they kill them off.

Wish they'd do the same with the mandatory +1 skills mods in various slots. That's the issue with gearing now, +1 all and +1 (class) skills are so good you don't consider items that can't easily have those mods added. So nerf them, so there's some diversity of gearing again.

83.author: twitticles
83.body:
As always, different causes get conflated into one issue - and this is super common when it comes to networking problems which alot of people don't quite seem to understand.

For some, their own equipment is the cause, for others it's their ISP or their routing. However, there are alot of us who are decently competent at troubleshooting and can quite confidently pinpoint this as being an issue at the data centers. Considering it's spread across multiple server locations my guess is that GGG simply doesn't pay for enough capacity or traffic priority, so when load is high we get relegated to worse server clusters.

This has been a frequent issue in the past, and it has, at least sometimes, been resolved between GGG and their hosting providers.

83.author: EnergyNonexistant
83.body:
> I don't know if I've ever seen a traceroute posted here that actually indicated GGG's datacenters were the problem

nope, same here.

I have however seen more than 50+++ winmtr dumps that in fact show the exact opposite... so it isn't looking great.

83.author: EnergyNonexistant
83.body:
> decently competent at troubleshooting and can quite confidently pinpoint this as being an issue at the data centers.

curious, care to share your findings that pinpoint this?

I've seen nothing but bs and winmtr reports that only show it's caused by ISP issues... so if you actually have something, something real, that might be something to use to get GGG on the case

83.author: twitticles
83.body:
Unfortunately I don't typically save logs unless there's an ongoing issue and I'm actively playing, which I'm not at this point of the league. And to be fair at a certain point such issues sour the gaming experience and (I'd presume) alot of us just move on to something else that isn't having a hissy fit, not bothering enough to help getting it resolved.

However I do idle quite a bit in-game (hoping for trades) and run traces whenever I load into a misbehaving instance. Over the last week I've run maybe half a dozen when there have been issues and just one of these revealed issues at previous hops that propagated to the data center, the others have all been clear of non-data center culprits.

I might as well start saving them if I do any more.

85.author: mcurley32
85.body:
awesome. Brutality is a really smart way to prove it. the wiki's description seems to imply that YOU have to be the source of at least one of the curses on the enemy. any chance you know about that, just out of curiosity? I imagine Profane Proxy is the easiest way to make something else reliably apply curses (or a curse on hit AG).

> It causes enemies with a curse applied by you a chance to explode when killed by you or your minions [...]

85.author: Yohsene
85.body:
It should just be a simple cursed yes/no condition. I'm not sure it's even possible for that effect to be specific to a certain player's curses. Curses are properties of the entity they're on, not the entity that inflicted them. (And the explosion isn't built into the curses, or Profane Bloom wouldn't need to mention minions.) 

A curse on hit AG would be the conclusive test. Profane Proxy puts your curse on the skitterbot, so that would still have your stats. Can't test it myself right now but I'd be shocked if Profane Bloom didn't work.

85.author: mcurley32
85.body: the only thing that gives a vague amount of credibility to the idea is the Evil Eye cluster jewel notable, but Profane Bloom's wording is nothing like that. I just thought it was strange to read that in the wiki and we were already on the subject. thanks for the insights.

85.author: Yohsene
85.body: Just tested and yep, an AG with curse on hit gloves can curse and kill all by itself and still cause explosions. Might edit the wiki's wording later!
